review.reviewBody: This hat is perfect for cold weather and completely blocks the wind.  I’ve worn it while the temp was in the low 20’s, with a slight wind and the hat kept my head nice and warm.

I was first introduced to OR during my early days with Naval Special Warfare. OR's gear has always been solid and tremendously reliable. Weeks back, I was saddened to know that I lost my favorite OR hat... I immediately ordered a new one and on the afternoon I received it, I found my lost one. Couldn't be happier to now have 2 OR beanies to fight off the cold winds of NYC. Awesome products!!
review.name: Perfect Fit. Solid, Reliable, Durable

review.reviewBody: Been wanting to snag one of these for a while and glad I did. Solid warm hat but especially blocks wind well. Soft strip along the ear line is a nice feature as well.
review.name: New favorite winter hat

review.reviewBody: Fits well I only wish it was an half inch shorter
review.name: Snug fit

review.reviewBody: I work on road and bridge construction in the Midwest. This is my second Wind Pro Hat, the first lasted me the past 6 winters. It works as advertised and is thin enough to comfortably wear under a hard hat, while staying in place for long hours. It comes down to my eyebrows in front, covers my ears & reaches to the middle of the back of my neck. It's the perfect cold/windy weather head covering for my application.
review.name: Perfect Cold Weather Companion

review.reviewBody: Super comfy and super warm. It’s an awesome beanie and I love the way it fits and feels. Thank you for all you do Backcountry
review.name: Love the Beanie

review.reviewBody: Hat fits snuggly on head with perfect amount of fleece.
review.name: Wind Stopping Warmth

review.reviewBody: Best winter hat available. Warm, lightweight, and comfortable.
review.name: Best there is!

review.reviewBody: I work outside most everyday as an electrician and this is the best winter at I've ever used. It keeps your head/ears warm in the snow or rain. I bought these for our trip to Hungry and they didn't disappoint traveling Europe for a week in all types of weather.
review.name: Best hat ever

review.reviewBody: Great hat. Kept my head nice and warm in some very windy environments.
review.name: Already told the wife she needs one

name: Wind Pro Hat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very pleased with my purchase. They run true to size and are super cushy & comfortable. Tested them off trail twice in Vermont and they had good traction on snow and slick pavement. I was also impressed with their warmth. While they could certainly handle a snowy hike, I have boots better suited for spikes & snowshoes.  I think these are best for slogging thru parking lots, walking round town and outdoor apres spaces. review.reviewBody: And I’ve used a Lot of shoes.. the update was purely a good thing: v2 ended up a few grams lighter than the first version since the lockdown is so much better so I was able to cut the laces off.. snappy and great for anything
review.name: Best trail racing shoe I’ve ever used

review.reviewBody:
My review  will only touch the fit and the general "feel " of this shoe. I ordered them online and I am sending them back after trying them on at home. The fit is obviously an individual matter and there is an inherent variability  in how every single shoe is manufactured, so not even the same model and size has to fit the same, but for it is worth here we go.
Their toebox is slightly more roomy than the one of the original S/lab Pulsar both widthwise and lengthwise. Or maybe it is just slightly taller and the same length. In any case, it feels more comfortable than the original Pulsar, but certainly tighter than Slab Pulsar SG and even the Sense 8. The midsole feels firmer than in Pulsar "1" and  "1" SG and the heel stack feels to be taller than that of Pulsar SG even if the numbers may be suggesting different. Also, the toe drop feels more noticeable than in Pulsar SG. This may be because the material of the midsole of Pulsar 2 is firmer/less squishy. The heel rocker of Pulsar 2 seems to be less pronounced than that of Pulsar  SG with the result of the heel feeling more stable. Again, possibly a consequence of the midsole being firmer. In any case, these are only my subjective observations, not any hard scientific data. 
The upper material seems to be consistent with the previous generation of Pulsars. However, I personally still find the breathability of the material of Sense 8 and its instep hugging properties better than any of these newer Matrix textiles.
As I said , I'll be returning these shoes soon. Not because I find them to be particularly bad on any aspect but they aren't what I was  hoping for ( basically a Pulsar "1" with more room in the toebox).
Just for final clarification, I was comparing here to the first generation of both S/lab Pulsar and S/lab Pulsar SG + the S/lab Sense 8.
review.name: Decent but nothing to write home about
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: I bought that month ago and Im so happy when wearing Salomon for race,
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody: I have raced in these shoes in a 20k up to a 50k! They are fast and responsive but they also provide enough protection to handle mountain running. The top mess fits like a sock. its amazing!
review.name: everything you want in a race shoe!

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this model because the shoes I have always used are the S/Lab Sense 6, 7 and 8 (they fit as if they were designed on my foot). This Pulsar 2, however, is completely different in fit, too wide on the forefoot, it lets my foot slide a little forward when going downhill, the toes hurt and the nails turn black. 
They are incredibly light. Remarkable cushioning. The durability of the sole is short, as expected. 
High price, but related to the excellent quality of the materials. I wouldn't buy them again due to the fit, just not right for my feet.
review.name: big disappointment
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: J'ai été très étonné par la réponse dynamique des Pulsars sur le terrain, je m'attendais à une tenue plus molle étant donné la semelles. Des chaussures nerveuses, rapides, légères!
review.name: Excellentes chaussures!

review.reviewBody: I rounded this shoe from 4.5 stars to 5 as it is great but not as great as the original.  The Pulsar 2 is definitely wider in the forefoot and especially noticed around corners with some sliding inside the shoe where there was none with the original.  I use medium weight socks in the original and will now use the heavy weight socks for V2.  Padding is also added to the heel area but seems unnecessary as I had no trouble with the V1.  Ingress is now definitely easier.  I love the red and purchased the V2 for the color.
review.name: V2 vs V1

review.reviewBody: Overall this shoe is much more comfy with a wider toe box. I think that may turn some off and others on to this shoe. I do think on the next model they should also widen the heal a bit to accommodate a smoother more stable ride. This is very much a shoe for people who run on the balls of their feet. Heel strikers will probably skip this shoe for that reason. The original version has much more of a response and bouncy feel to it. The same descents in these shoes make my feet and quads aware of this. Overall still a great shoe..more comfy but unfortunately without the ride of the original.
review.name: Pros and Cons!
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.name: Great shoes, very comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Metro II Chukka WP - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are great boots- keep feet dry- have a teenager wearing them- and they have held up to him. Only thing is I bought them for my teenage son last year and I thought I would go up a size, but this year’s version doesn’t have as much rubber protection on the toe and heel- are they as good as last year’s? They still look nice, although I like the style of last year’s a little better, but they still look good.
review.name: Great Boot

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Metro II Chukka WP - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've worn Sorels before for casual shoes and though these might be a decent buy, but found that they lacked arch support and weren't particularly comfortable in brief wear around my house. They're narrower than I expected and pinch across the top of my foot, just behind the toes - and I don't have volumetric feet by any means. It's a shame, because they're a nice looking shoe.
review.name: Mediocre and not very comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Metro II Chukka WP - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent shoes...very, very comfortable...One suggestion...the tab on the back of the shoe is too small to get your fingers in to pull on the shoe...make it a little larger....other than that, couldn't be happier...
review.name: great buy

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Metro II Chukka WP - Men's
review.reviewBody: A great shoe for a rainy day. I do have to spend time outside walking to work and back, which is a few miles. They keep my feet dry and are comfortable.
review.name: Waterproof shoe

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Metro II Chukka WP - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good looking shoes, well constructed. I work in the brewing industry and hate wearing rubber boots all day in the brewery. These boots keep my feet dry and are comfortable, but the are VERY narrow. I don't have large feet (usually a 9.5) ordered a 9 they fit fine, but even for my small feet fit VERY narrow. I am hoping they will break in more and not be as tight on the sides. They are waterproof so far and are great for being in wet environments all day. If you have wide feet I wouldn't be surprised if they don't fit well. Definitely order a size down as these size smaller than other shoes.
review.name: Good shoe, but narrow

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Metro II Chukka WP - Men's
review.reviewBody: Stylish and comfortable. I went with a half size up to account for thicker socks.
review.name: Nice boots

review.itemreviewed: Sorel Metro II Chukka WP - Men's
review.reviewBody: The quality is amazing, no doubt, but they're too narrow and I have an average foot. I usually wear a 10 and sized down to 9.5
review.name: Not for me

description: Buy the Salomon Cross Season Race Flag Bladder online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cross Season Race Flag Bladder
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon Cross Season Race Flag Bladder online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I originally bought it for either ease of water access so I could use space in a vest strictly for packing other goods or to carry additional items in it as a front pack without the water bladder. So far I have only used it configured as Salomon intended. 
I ended up taking this on a 32 mile hike down an old decommissioned logging railroad line turned bike path from the mountains to the farm lands. Carried water, headlamp, phone, very thin rain jacket (Pategonia Houdini) and a sandwich and trail snack bar. I slid a holster of bear spray to the belt.  The belt stayed tight and didn't sag, maybe adjusted it twice as load changed or refilled water.  Was very impressed.  I wish it opened to access a little more of the storage space.  I feel like some of the volume was not able to be utilized because of the folding closure system and the way it was sewn. However,  if you can fit it in,  it won't move around even with something oddly heavy pulling down on one side and a very heavy phone in the pack. 
Maybe Salomon will make a lumbar pack that is a little bigger in the future? For now,  this one worked out great.
review.name: Pleased with performance

review.reviewBody:
I specifically bought this for mountain biking after not liking some of the bulky, overbuilt hip packs from over brands. The lightweight material and roll-top enclosure make it my favorite go-to for big days when versatility and comfort are my top priority. 

I didn't have any issue with the hose retention loop thing while riding, but I did attach a small, retractable tether to the hose right below the valve so I could simply let go of the valve when I'm done drinking and have it snap back in place at my side.
review.name: Bought for mountain biking

review.reviewBody: I bought this because I hate handhelds and wanted something more minimal than my vest. I also hate putting bottles away in belts. It succeeds at being minimal and feeling good on my waist. But beyond that the bag isn’t very impressive. The hose management is elementary at best. Whoever thought an elastic band was a good idea has never worn a MTB and waistpack with a magnetic clip. Also, if you just out the bite valve through it flops against your thighs when you run. But if you push it further through the bite valve just flops around on your left side. It’s super annoying. You can’t shorten the hose because then it won’t reach your mouth. Overall it’s really a very disappointing design from a company I know understands the demands of elite runners. I don’t think this pack was tested by many people.
review.name: Below average
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody:
I got this just a month ago and I'm so glad I did! The 2 seperate storage areas are an amazing feature as well as the thermal insulated tubing for the bladder.
I got this for short hikes and hours of paddling lakes and ponds, but also great for many different adventures! It's a loaded with lots of features and benefits to aid in a great day outside no matter what you do!
review.name: So many options

name: Cross Season Race Flag Bladder

description: Buy the Yakima Frontloader Bike Mount online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Frontloader Bike Mount
hasVariant.description: Buy the Yakima Frontloader Bike Mount online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Unless your front wheel is incapable of being removed from your frame, you should not buy this rack. I got this a Kuat Trio, thinking that removing my wheel would be annoying but boy, was I wrong. I immediately traded it in for another Trio. Having the front wheel on requires you to lift the bike even higher to get it on the rack and this design forced you have hold the bike perfectly vertical in order to even start to get it into the restraint. Aside from the lack of usability, Yakima made the insane decision to not include the lock cores on their cable WHICH IS NOT REMOVABLE and is also poorly held in place so the end is likely to fall out and scratch your roof... The tool-less install was ok, but tool-less install also means tool-less removal by you or anyone else.
TL;DR: buy almost any other rack, even if you have to pay more.
review.name: Huge pain

review.reviewBody: I have rely enjoyed this rack, it fits both my 29 and 26 inch tires perfectly. There is very little movement from side to side. It can be hard to hoist the bike up so make sure your car isn't too tall.
review.name: Great! Sturdy and sleek

review.reviewBody:
I decided to try these because I have a pair of Shamans that I use for hard projects that I like a lot and I wanted to see if these were even better for me. 

Both shoes are well made, are aggressive and have Trax SaS rubber which is quite is sticky. The Pro has an elastic sleeve and only one strap instead of the three that the Shaman has. This allows you to get your shoes on move quickly but gives a little less control over the fit. 

The Pro is also slightly less stiff than the Shaman. The fit across the toebox was significantly tighter on the Pro and it felt narrower (even when I went up a half size) while the heel is very slightly lower volume compared to the Shaman. 

I don't think either shoe is clearly better than the other so it will come down to fit. For me, the original Shaman fits better.
review.name: Quality Alternative to the Shaman

review.reviewBody: My street shoe size is an 8.5... the recommendation was to buy street shoe size for a tight fit, but my foot didn't even fit into the shoe when I tried an 8.5. I wear a 41 in La Sportiva Solution shoes - but I had to buy a 9.5 in the Evolv Shaman Pro to have a similar feel and fit. The toe box provides good width for my foot shape, but the "love bump" also keeps my toe knuckles from jamming uncomfortably when I climb.
review.name: Rediculously small, but solid

review.reviewBody: I became a fan of Evolve shoes when I bought a pair of Shaman Laces instead of just another pair of Katana Laces.  I was attracted to the severe downturn, asymmetry, split sole and - yes - cool aesthetics.  I really like them and climb in them pretty much exclusively now.  FWIW: I wear 45.5/12 in LaSportiva but 13 in both these Shaman models. At the gym, I noticed many people Bouldering in Phantoms; but, unlike many other people, I think they are ugly = sorry.  I was all set to get a pair of Phantoms anyway when I saw this new model and got it instead.  I am not an expert Climber nor Boulderer, so take my evaluation with that grain of salt.  Yes, this shoe is a little bit tighter than the Shaman Lace; but I kinda like that "send" feeling; and it's not uncomfortable.  Indeed, after a few sessions, these shoes have molded to my feet and become tight but comfortable.  I think because the "Love Bump" plate is thinner in this model, the forefoot is more flexible than my Shaman Laces; and I would assume that's true vs the Phantoms that have 4.2 mm of rubber underneath the forefoot and felt "stiff" to me.  I get this feeling that I could scrunch my toes and "grab" a feature, kind of like a monkey can do with their prehensile feet.  I like this phenomenon, and think you might too.  As you can see, there's not as much rubber on the top as the Phantom, in case that is an issue with you and you blow through that part of your shoes.  The heel grasps mine very tightly, so I doubt you would encounter heel slips with this model.  In all, I like them and they are helping my Bouldering progress.  If you like Evolve as much as I do now, you can't go wrong with either these babies or the Phantoms; but you might find these a little softer and more flexible than the Phantoms.
review.name: A Worthy Alternative To The Phantom

review.reviewBody: A little bit softer and more sensitivity to the Shaman, but overall still a supportive/stiff shoe. This was a little bit tighter compared to the Shamans and Phantoms. Still stayed with the same size (10.5 USM), but the Pro is definitely going to be a more "sending fit" than an all-day shoe, which is perfect because this will be a great shoe for the tough projects.
review.name: Subtle but Great Upgrade from Shaman

name: Shaman Pro Shoe
Shaman Pro Shoe

review.reviewBody: Great fit, especially if you have taller arches. Tongue could be a little softer as it rubs a bit but guessing this will wear in over time.
review.name: Good boot, fits better than most, comfortable and warm

review.reviewBody: Love the boot this autumn, though yet to test in truly wintry and wet conditions. It is well-padded inside in addition to being sized a bit small, so you're going to have to size up quite a bit, at least 1.5 from walking shoes and 2 sizes from running shoes I would say, though be prepared to return and re-purchase for the right fit, since The North Face does not permit exchanges.
review.name: Feels great (prepare to size up), though pre-winter

review.reviewBody: This boot has no tread depth. To be able to obtain traction on slush and snow, you need tread depth. This boot doesn't have it. What a shame. Why would they make a boot with no tread depth.
review.name: Better designed boots out there

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm and waterproof. Had an eyelet come off on first try on but TNF took care of that and promptly sent me a new pair.
review.name: Waterproof warm winter boots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great for after skiing boots. I also really liked the color. Personally I am a little tired of the all black look.
review.name: Would definitely recommend and buy again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this new design, the construction and the comfort of these pair
review.name: Great snow boots !!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots are made well. My only concern is that the toe area is too narrow. I normally wear wide shoes, so I had to order a size up, and the toes still seem a bit too snug
review.name: Narrow

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm an Alaskan Heli-ski pilot. I use these boots to fly in and love the feel and dexterity they provide along with keeping my feet warm.
review.name: I would buy these again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The most under rated brand ever, North Face everything is legendary and iconic
review.name: I would give these boots more stars if I can.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used these for snowy city walking and they're great, keep my feet warm and are super comfortable. This is my second pair
review.name: I would buy this again

review.reviewBody: I knew this sweater was ugly going into my purchase, but when it arrived, it was even uglier than it was online. That's fine, I was shopping for an ugly sweater and I got one. What isn't fine is the sizing. I wear and XL 90% of the time and a 2XL the other 10% of the time, depending on the cut. I ordered the XL in this case because I read that they run big - I had no idea!!!! The XL fit like a dress. I'm 6' and it literally went down to my mid-thighs. So, I ordered a L, thinking that would solve the problem. I've literally only had one size L item fit since I became an adult, so I wasn't sure how the L would fit. Turns out the L fit well through the shoulders and chest, but it was still way too long. It fit like a tunic, and the graphic was literally down around my waist. In short, if you're looking for an ugly sweater, order at least 1.5 sizes smaller than normal, and know that you probably won't have to wear pants with it.
review.name: HUGE and ugly

review.reviewBody: Sweater seems to be well made, although it is much thinner than I anticipated. It also runs very big. I normally wear an XL and I was swimming in it. I thought the size/cut was weird too so I didn't bother trying the Large.
review.name: Nice Quality - too big

name: Highline Sweater - Men's

review.reviewBody: Happy customer. Nice, comfortable shoes for the price
review.name: Nice shoes for the $$

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Tech Lace Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these as a stylish sneaker and so far they fit the bill! Have walked a few miles at a time in these shoes and they've been comfortable. 

I have generally wide, big feet, and other than a little tightness in the toes, I found them to be comfortable. I will likely experiment with how tightly I tie them. 

I normally always wear socks so I didn't experience any rubbing, and my socks stayed up as expected! 

Great pair of shoes, excited to own my first pair of Sorels!
review.name: Stylish and comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Tech Lace Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: The moment I put the shoes on, I gave a deep sigh of contentment. They are very comfortable and help guard against my shin splints when I walk. The color is great as spring is almost here and the material breaths well. I can buy Sorels w confidence that a 9.5 will fit me perfectly.
review.name: Comfortable and Cool

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Tech Lace Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: These fit oddly. They are meant for a wider foot. Very little support on the sides of the shoe.
review.name: Odd fit
comment: Hello Carolyn D, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Kinetic™ Breakthru Tech Lace Sneaker is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Tech Lace Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: These shoes are super cute and I really tried to love them but unfortunately they are the least comfortable tennis shoes I’ve ever worn. The defect with the tongue being too small is An ongoing problem. There are weird bump outs by the heel that made my heel rub up and down, making my socks fall down while wearing. Unfortunately, I cannot return because I recycled the box but sadly, I cannot wear them, unless I want to deal with sore feet all day.
review.name: Really disappointing
comment: Hello Cindy, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry Women's Kinetic™ Breakthru Tech Lace Sneaker didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Tech Lace Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the chunky tech look-super stylish & pretty comfy. -1 star for the weird rubbing by the heel. You for sure have to wear socks to minimize the rubbing.
review.name: Trendy sneaks

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Tech Lace Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these shoes, comfortable, stylish and so happy with my purchase. I am a size 12 and appreciate the size availability.
review.name: Great style

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Tech Lace Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been searching for cute white shoes that I can walk for awhile in and I'm happy to say these are them! They are so cute and have a comfortable bottom that adds some height. They aren't water proof but they wipe off easy and are tall so you can avoid water puddles. I just tie the laces tight so they stay tied but they fit well. I definitely recommend!
review.name: Cute and Comy

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Tech Lace Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the look of the shoes but they are difficult to wear. The laces don’t stay put as you tie them so you have to keep a lot of pressure to keep the lower part tight. There also doesn't seem to be enough width to the tongue towards the toe end of the shoe, so sometimes the fabric  comes untucked and gaps on either side.
review.name: Meh
comment: Hello Becca, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry Women's Kinetic™ Breakthru Tech Lace Sneaker didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes, I’m on my 4th pair. They hold up well in the creek and with the asymmetric design and low profile toe box they perform amazing in both thin to wide cracks. The stiff sole gives my feet support and makes for an excellent performance shoe on technical terrain. I don’t wear these for multi-pitch as they are too stiff for all day comfort, but difficult trad cragging is where they shine. My one hope is that the lacing system could hold up better, but I really do go hard on my shoes.
review.name: My go-to trad shoe!

review.reviewBody: Nice climbing shoe, fit was slightly smaller than expected

I used these shoes while I was progressing from V2-->V5 indoor bouldering. Incredibly comfortable, I never needed to take them off even during 2+ hour sessions including walking around. The lace up allowed me to get them very snug. After about 6 months, 3 days per week use, the toes are starting to wear out in terms of durability (this could be me being a toe dragger). Overall a great shoe for beginners to intermediates that don't need the precision or strength of a more contoured shoe. In that grade range I never felt the shoe holding me back.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody: Whether I am working the Moon Board, working the moves of Burden on my home wall, Taking my 8yo out on a 5.8 sport... This show has given me confidence on tackling FA's in Co and tricky thin had splitters in the Creek. BD hit a home run with this shoe.
review.name: Amazing in Performance and Construction

review.reviewBody: The shoes are 10x better that school gym rentals and 100x better than basic running shoes; the size is similar to my Hoka running shoes but the heel is a smidge too loose but otherwise a non issue.
review.name: Helpful

review.reviewBody: Love these shoes! They are built solidly, very comfortable, and climb well. They are my go-to shoe for longer affairs in the mountains, or for easy days at the crags.
review.name: Excellent All-day Trad Shoe!

review.reviewBody: Good thick layer of protection for crack jamming. Would recommend women try on in person to get the right sizing comparison
review.name: Good crack shoe

review.reviewBody: I’ve jumped all over the map to find a trad shoe that is secure and technical enough to handle finger tip cracks all the way to big hands and edge like a champ. This shoe was immediate magic once I put it on. Great traction, great fit, and a wide range of use. I normally wear a 10-10/12 st shoe. I got a 9 1/2 in this shoe and it’s snug toes but quickly feels molded to your foot. Can’t say enough good things. Fit wise for the performance, it beats most other trad shoes at a far better price. Nice job BD
review.name: Perfect trad shoe.

review.reviewBody: Narrow feet but my street shoe size squashed my toes into a bent position. Might be that I’m a beginner but these felt much more curved/uncomfortable than the neutral rentals I’ve used. I suspect these run half a size small but maybe they are just for a more serious climber!
review.name: Very tight - had to return

review.reviewBody: Buy it in your shoe size. Black Diamond has done a great job at making the sizes fit. If you are old school, or just like being uncomfortable, 1/2 size down. They fit great, have good wear, and beat the TC Pros, with the savings. It’s a trad shoe, so you want to be able to spend time in them all day.  However, size down and you can make them do anything.
review.name: Great Everything Shoe

name: Aspect Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought these chacos as a birthday gift for a friend, but I've had a pair of my own for 4 years, and have worn them on hikes, in the water on lake trips, every day of week long summer camps, and to day long amusement park trips and they have never once hurt my feet or caused any kind of blisters. I wear them almost every day in the summers and after 4 years haven't noticed any signs of wear.
review.name: I wear them to do anything
comment: Stellar! Thanks for the great feedback Andie!

review.reviewBody: No matter how much I adjusted the straps they were always too tight around my toe.
review.name: Too tight on toes
comment: Thanks for your feedback Ami. Most times you can fix the toe tightening by washing your sandals.  Wash on a gentle cycle in cold water with a mild detergent.  (Do not use fabric softener) Let them air dry.  If this does not work for your our ReChaco team can fix them for you, give them a shout at 888-211-9211 Ext 1 M-F 8am-5pm EST.  Hope this helps!

review.reviewBody: I didn’t like the strap around my big toe on the Z2’s.  I like Z’s better.
review.name: Z 2’s

review.reviewBody: My new chacos are fun colored, comfortable, and light-weight compared to my first pair. I have worn my first pair for over 10 years. It was time for new Chacos and I am not disappointed.
review.name: Love the new colors

review.reviewBody: I love my new Chaco's!   They are super comfortable.  I appreciate the rugged bottoms and the adjustable straps.  I like the toe loop design.  I do have a narrower foot - so I wish the "leftover" strap could somehow adjust so that it doesn't hang.
review.name: Great design - comfortable and supportive
comment: Thanks for the awesome 5-stars Margaret!

review.reviewBody: Love these, as always. Finally bought a replacement for my first pair of chacos that I bought 12 years ago and wore all spring/summer/fall for many years and most of the summer for the past several years.
review.name: Classics.
comment: Thanks for being a long-time fan!

review.reviewBody: I bought this exact pair of chacos. I love the color and size was good BUT they do not have the cloud sole. That is what I was hoping for and it is the same old sole like my previous pairs of chacos.
review.name: Not exactly what I expected!

review.reviewBody: I would love to review the sandals I ordered, but they didn't fit and they didn't have a replacement.
review.name: Can't help

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, broke in quickly and look great. Have the version without the toe strap which I love and wanted to see the difference. This definitely feels more supportive.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: I was so excited to get the but I couldn’t even put them on. I even watched videos for some reason I could not get them on my feet and I have normal size feet size 7. It was frustrating so I thought if it’s gonna take that long to put on a pair of shoes they’re going back.
review.name: Hard to get on !

name: ZX/2 Cloud Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Overall a decent liner short but with a few minor issues.
The chamois is a bit large in the front for me and feels wide while walking around.
The chamois itself is simple looking, no raised bits like some others but it's pretty comfortable in spite of the front feeling a little bulky.
The material the short is made from isn't as open weave as I'd like, on the few hot days I've worn it it seems like it doesn't breathe as well as a few other liners I have.
Overall I think you get what you pay for and for $50 it's a good deal. I think if the chamois was slightly slimmer I'd give it another star.
review.name: Good with a few minor issues

review.reviewBody: This great fitting liner quickly became my go to liner for big MTB rides. Chamois is very comfortable but not too thick.  Thinner mesh on sides keeps me cooler - a huge plus!
review.name: New go-to liner short

review.reviewBody: I bought medium  PI transfer Liner Shorts and they work well.  But I much prefer the earlier PI liner shorts with a shorter leg and inseam.  I haven't been able to find them.
review.name: Good short liners long in the leg

name: Transfer Liner Short - Men's

review.reviewBody:
If you are even considering venturing into the Backcountry, buy this AND take a AIRIE course! 

With COVID redefining everything, including the backcountry, knowing before you go is just the first step in participating in the outdoors safely. There is so much beauty and fun to be had, just make sure to prepare yourself. An avalanche beacon is the first step in understanding the backcountry. 

BCAs beacon *is* the go to here in Colorado and I highly recommend their newest addition.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Western Mountaineering Antelope MF Sleeping Bag: 5F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This fall I absolutely agonized over what winter bag to buy. Hours and hours spent checking just about every forum and company website I could find on the subject on the internet, comparing weights, warmths, features and finally just decided to bite the bullet and pay out for this bag from Western Mountaineering. It could still prove to be insufficiently warm for some of the adventures that I have in mind but as far as this bag itself goes, it's flawless. I've described it to people as the nicest thing that I've ever owned. 

There's no sloppiness to the product, everything feels just so on it. It seems durable but not overly so. In particular I love how the draft collar is designed with a strong clasp and elastic cord. The hood shuts tight and also completely envelopes my head. I've taken it out twice so far this season, nothing extreme lowest temp something like 15F, and I've woken up each morning completely at ease. 

I'm a western mountaineering convert for life.

Note, I'm 5' 11" and bought the 6' 6" bag based on some advice. It's definitely overly big for me, but I do like that I can literally store a pair of boots in the foot box.
review.name: Simple-It's Flawless

name: Antelope MF Sleeping Bag: 5F Down

review.reviewBody: I’m a short kind of fat thick guy, and the rise on these shorts made them a crazy fit for me. The zipper was probably 5” too long for my build at 5’6”. To have them fall above the knee as intended, the waist was above my diaphragm.
review.name: Large Rise

review.reviewBody:
These shorts are very good in all aspects of use and wear. Tightly woven material is a great blend of toughness and comfort, offering ample stretch and nice ?feel? against the skin; these shorts dry overnight after washing. These shorts are not ?ultra lightweight? but not ?heavy? either, but a good balance of a weave that can tolerate the abuses of the elements, yet with an attractive appearance. 
Leg opening diameter is good and the inseam length is great for walking and are comfortable to swim in; no water absorption. Pocket configuration is optimal; zipockets  hold a cellphone no problem. The front snap is a bit overly heavy duty and can offer resistance to being pulled apart/opened... but it?s really not a problem. Overall: UBER!
review.name: Excellent pair of Shorts

review.reviewBody:
Purchased for husband for father's day but they are smaller in waist than all his other shorts.  He's 6'2" and 180.  Our daughter purchased a similar pair, same size (34) but a different brand and the Kuhls are 2 inches smaller in the waist.  He recently retired a pair of Kuhls he bought 11 years ago and has worn consistently throughout every summer for hiking, kayaking and general use.     
My husband loved everything about these so he asked me to get the next size up despite a new similar pair from another brand.  He says you can't beat the quality and features of Kuhl!
review.name: Almost perfect but runs small

name: Renegade 8in Short - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Powerstretch Pro Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this to use as an outer layer for hiking. I’ve worn it a few times and my impression thus far is that it’s quite warm, form fitting and will be excellent for cold weather. The only con might be that it’s a little on the heavy side. I’m 6’3”, 185lbs and bought a Large. The fit is perfect and am happy the sleeves and body are a little on the longer side. One really nice feature is that the front panels absolutely block the wind. Also the hood is snug and meant to be worn under vice over a helmet
review.name: Heavy Duty midlayer

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Powerstretch Pro Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a fleece jacket with water/wind resistant exterior to replace my Stoic Breaker that had wind pro in it. I LOVE this jacket. 

Front exterior is water/wind resistant, under the arms and back are PowerStretch Pro. Love the Pockets and hood is great when down or up (though doesn't have a toggle cord - you don't need one as it is fitted and deep enough to fit my ponytail that was on top of my head ). Hood would accommodate a bike helmet and could fit underneath one as well. It is midweight but will breath enough for hiking, BC (under a shell), or just bopping around. The thumbholes just up the game on this jacket. Fit is typical Norrona - athletic fit with longer arms and length provides good coverage w/o being too long in the torso. I got my usual men's small size and have room to layer. It is a keeper!!
review.name: Love This Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Powerstretch Pro Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Just received this jacket and want to share my first impressions.   I?ve only tested it as a true second layer with my Arcteryx Rush shell and have to say it is a perfect mid layer The material is stretchy and breathable and the panels of wool in the critical areas are perfect  what I really like about the Norrona products is they put all the pockets in the right place and the two upper pockets on your chest are perfect.  This is where my shell was slightly lacking and now my second layer will be equipped with plenty of storage.   The outer surface of this jacket is smooth as it is not just fleece material. That said I envision this as a second layer on the colder days.

This is also a standalone jacket and I?ve been wearing it now in the spring with just a high-tech T-shirt below.  I absolutely love the feel of this jacket.    It is formfitting and I am 55 and 162 pounds and it fits snug however perfect.  The wrists have thumb holes so if you really wanna keep the wind out in your hands and wrists warm it?s great.   The hood is also formfitting and when flipped down and the jacket is all the way zipped up it provides excellent protection to your neck all the way up to your chin.  Again this is where Norona does well as the material on the inside of the front zipper is very comfortable against your chin or face if you were ducking in to stay warm.    The hood does fit under my helmet no problem or just as a hoodie fits nice and snug and really keeps you warm

For spring and fall this will be my go to jacket. I seem to be laying around the house wearing it too.   Once winter comes back this will be my primary second layer under my ski shell

I will pick up one more Norona second layer fleece jacket that is truly fuzzy fleece that I will look to make as a different second layer option for slightly warmer days.    

These are only my impressions I haven?t tested out everything extensively yet but at age 57 I?ve worn some clothing in my life

I love this jacket and I love Norrona products
review.name: Awesome Second Layer Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Powerstretch Pro Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is one of the all time mid-layers.  It's absolutely a beautiful Jacket - but 
functional.

The wool blend is genius and wicks sweat and keeps you dry.  Design on point
with with the patterning and color ways, Napolean pockets (always rock) with
long zippers (on point).  I used this snowboarding in Hokkaido and for going out
at night.  Simply all time.  Nothing else comes close on the market.   Fit is snug, 
I'm close to 5"9" 163 and bought a M my normal size and but returned it and got a large - 
L was perfection.  I ended up buying the cool black after I got the caviar black.  
 
Norrona never ever stop making this.
review.name: Beautiful Jacket - All time
comment:
Iooking to use this as my go to mid layer under my Gortex shell for in bounds and out of bounds skiing.   Makes sense right?   Looks like it can alse be a stand alone cool weather jacket.    Does it have mid wind block or is it mostly breathable.   I?m hoping mostly breathable.  Let my shell do the outer protection.   

Lastly wonder if M will fit 5?5? 162 lbs.   Only size in stock?.  Hope so

name: Trollveggen Powerstretch Pro Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.name: Emergency Fire Blanket
hasVariant.description: Buy the S.O.L Survive Outdoors Longer Emergency Fire Blanket online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] What a great tool to have in your arsenal! I didn’t realize how large it would be until I opened it up. The material is slick but durable feeling. I had a small fire in my backyard & thought this would be the perfect test for it. It snubbed the fire out in seconds! Actually super neat & a great item to have on hand. It’s large which makes for maximum coverage & it looks brand new even after covering a fire. I like the gear bag it came in too. 10/10 - everyone should have one of these to cover outside fires or someone on fire!
review.name: Big fire blanket!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This fire blanket is a must-have for any emergency preparedness kit. It came in a compact size and ease of use. The blanket is made of durable, flame-retardant material that can withstand high temperatures, making it ideal for extinguishing small fires or for protecting from flames in an emergency.

What I love most about this fire blanket is its versatility. Not only can it be used to smother flames or wrap around a person to shield them from fire, but it can also double as a signaling device in case of rescue. The blanket's reflective surface is highly visible and can help you attract attention in low-light conditions!

But I hope I done have to use it at all 😆 🤞🏼
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome fire blanket, heavy duty while still being lightweight enough to take along on camping trips. I think it would be too heavy for backpacking, but camping it’s perfect, and it’s also a great thing to keep under the kitchen sink just in case.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] What a wonderful idea and product. One can’t be prepared enough for the safety. This is a miracle heat resistant blanket. So durable and worth the price. Easy to carry along. Definitely recommend.
review.name: Best safety blanket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As someone who lives in a place where fires can happen just like that, this is great to have on hand! We are keeping it in our car for any type of emergency.
review.name: Safety first!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm very glad I got this Sol Emergency Fire blanket. We Used it once outside during mother's day. Works really great  we definitely bringing this too on our future camping this year!!!
Highly recommended!!!
review.name: Saviour!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven't actually been able to use this yet but fortunately so! Who wants a fire?? Lol. But from what I can tell it will do its job. Very thick, durable, easy to rip open bag that it comes in. Has instructions on how to use it on the bag. Box that it comes in is attractive looking and durable so to not expect any cuts or rips in blanket. Little heavy in weight so probably not the best for backpackers just camping.
review.name: Good Product for Fires

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sol Emergency Fire Blanket is a must-have for any home, car, or workplace. This compact and lightweight blanket is designed to extinguish small fires and provide a safe escape route in emergency.
The Sol Emergency Fire Blanket is a reliable and easy-to-use tool for small fire emergencies. Its compact design and durability make it a great addition to any emergency kit or first aid supply. While it's not a substitute for proper fire safety equipment, it's a valuable asset for quick response and escape.
I highly recommend the Sol Emergency Fire Blanket for anyone looking for a simple and effective fire safety solution. It's perfect for homes, cars, offices, or any place where fire safety is a concern.
review.name: Great for emergency

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great brand familiarity and has always served the purpose very well. I take camping, keep one in my vehicle and keep some at the house and in the garage as well!
review.name: Serves its purpose well!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I truly believe any home, vehicle, business shop, even your campsite should have one of these. This is peace of mind if a fire ever starts from sparks and gains momentum. It is 100% FLAME-RETARDANT FIBERGLASS and can be used in an emergency to extinguish fires on people, pets, or things.
review.name: Accessible fast emergency equipment

name: Emergency Fire Blanket

review.reviewBody:
This is my first pair of long riding pants and it fit great! They run snug on my thighs but it's not uncomfortable since it has a lot of stretch. I wore this with 7IDP Sam Hill signature knee pads and it paired very well. 
I was a little concerned how comfortable they would be in tropical weather. But I rode in these for 1.5 hours in 32-degree Celsius (90 F) weather they were comfortable. They are breathable and didn't trap sweat. I took a chance with these and it paid off. Now I'm looking for another pair to purchase.
review.name: Awesome Pants

review.reviewBody: Good looking pants on or off the trail, breathable and no problems during a ride. Wore my TLD T-Bone knee pads underneath and it paired well.
review.name: Nice pants!

review.reviewBody:
Bought these to replace another Asolo pair that had worn out.  Loved the fact that these boots are crampon compatible.  Worked great for trekking in Uganda. 

Keep my feet warm during winter hiking/snowshoeing in Colorado, too.
review.name: Great Boots

review.reviewBody: My two feet were very tired and sore at the end of 20miles difficult hike. The trail was rocky.   My fellow hiker recommended me to wear Mountaineering Boot instead for next hike. I wore it to the same trail yesterday. It worked out great, I did not experienced feet sore nor tiredness at the end. Thumb up for it.
review.name: Best pair for me

review.reviewBody: Wore these for a very rocky climb with about a 3,000 foot elevation gain. They fit perfectly. Great foot and ankle support, couldn't feel the sharp rocks. And love the cheerful colors. Did a six mile hike first time out, no chafing, slipping or anything. Would absolutely buy again.
review.name: These totally rock!

review.reviewBody: Cannot give enough praise to this boot. Sticky soles, extremely durable, handy for snow and glacier travel, great traction in mud and scree, and they’re actually comfortable on distance endeavors. I tested these bad boys in some very rough terrain and they just shrugged it off. If you need a heavier boot that does everything but don’t need the insulation, this is the one.
review.name: Got it in Men’s When It Was Available

review.reviewBody: I've had these for over a year. They are incredibly tight across the bridge of the foot.  I've tried everything to stretch them out and nothing works.  Also, the unstructured tow makes it look like a moccasin.  I own other Red Wings that I love.  Pass on these.

comment: Hello, we appreciate you taking the time to leave your honest feedback on your recent purchase from us. We are so sorry to hear you were disappointed with the quality of your boots. I will be reaching out to you directly to hopefully turn your experience around.

review.reviewBody: Great fitting shoe.  Comfortable pretty much right out of the box. Same American made Red Wing quality that has been boasted for years.  Definitely recommend!

comment: Thank you for this kind review! I am so glad they are working so well for you!

review.reviewBody:
I have been looking for a replacement for a LONG time for my favorite pair of mid height chukka boots. I finally found what I was looking for! When I travel for work I need something versatile that I can dress up or down. They're very comfortable and are a nice do it all thing. I did not have any issues with break in but I have worn a lot of footwear with a "break in period" so my feet may just be used to it. 

I would love to see some other colorways in this style, I'd gladly buy another.
review.name: So Happy!
comment: Thank you for your review. We are happy you finally found a replacement for your favorite mid-height Chukka boots. And, we are glad that you've enjoyed these so much you want to make another purchase! We hope we continue to meet your expectations.

review.reviewBody: Really like these. I have no real complaints other than I want a black pair which they do not make anymore or at this time
review.name: My go to
comment: Thank you for the review! We'll take this feedback into consideration when releasing new styles!

review.reviewBody: Great quality shoe with excellent craftsmanship it has held up well from all the abuse I’ve thrown at it. I’ve seen some reviews about how these shoes don’t hold up like other redwings but my experience has been good so far. Had these for over 2+ years now and this has been my primary travel shoe. From Abu Dhabi, Istanbul, Vancouver, San Francisco, LA, Toronto, Montreal, Philippines, Seoul, Taipei, Tokyo, London, Dublin, Barcelona, Valencia, Seville, Bahrain and Frankfurt these shoes have been everywhere and every terrain from rain and mud to cobblestones. From airport lounges to navigating the London Underground. Only complaint would be insole could be a little bit more comfortable and they do take a while to break in initially but couldn’t be happier with these.
review.name: Almost perfect
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you, no matter the terrain. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: Purchased these in store in a 9 same as my classic chelsea’s and even after they broke in for a month they still kill my toes due to the low unstructured style. Can’t return now but will try a 9.5 in the future
review.name: Size up!
comment: Thank you for your honest review. We are sorry to hear your boots did not live up to your expectations. We hope you will give our brand another chance in the future. Take care!

review.reviewBody: Picked these boots a while ago and they have turned into one of my favorite go to everyday boot!
review.name: Great comfort!
comment: Thanks for leaving us this great review and for letting us know that you are enjoying your boots.

review.reviewBody: I Bought this month  and Love it. I like more than I say something
review.name: GOOD
comment: Thank you for letting us know that you love your new boots!

review.reviewBody: I bought these Chelsea a month ago and stitching on the elastic already popped (basically medial high Achilles). I have been wearing Red Wing shoes for the past 7 years, these being my 10th pair, and none of them have failed like this, not even on my 2016 Iron Rangers. These boots were barely into the break in stage; I had only wore them around the house and short trips like for groceries to ease into them. I really wanted to like these boots as they're handsome and started to get comfortable. I'm incredibly dissapointed.
review.name: Poor quality.
comment: I am sorry that this has happened. I will email you to provide assistance.

review.reviewBody: I'd buy something like this if it weren't elastic, all leather like a Pecos with the oro sole
review.name: Better more like a Pecos
comment: Thank you for your suggestions! We will pass this along. We hope you choose to shop with us!

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 1 Mid GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these as my first pair of real hiking shoes.  I purchased these in a 7.5, but had to return them for being too big.  I repurchased in a 7 and had no problem with the return or repurchase.  I normally wear an 8-8.5 in womens.  I found them tight upon initially trying them on.  After walking around for a minute though they felt much more comfortable.  I decided to keep them and cut off the tags.  The main thing I was looking for in hiking shoes was ankle support, and these seem to have a sufficient amount for me (someone who frequently rolls their ankles).  I decided I would wear them to the grocery to test out how I would need to break them in.  I was pleasantly surprised that they were immediately comfortable.  However, when I returned to my vehicle after barely an hour of being out, I noticed a small tear along the seam where the black stretchy part at the top begins.  I have contacted the warranty department since I can no longer return them since I wore them and cut the tags off.  We will see what they decide to do about it.  The issue isn't structural to the shoe, but it still shouldn't be happening, especially not on shoes that are meant to withstand so much more.
review.name: Was excited, but am disappointed
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 1 Mid GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love this hiking shoe.  Super comfortable, great support and traction.  I wondered how I would like the loop pull opening, but it’s relatively easy to out on.  The unique opening keeps snow out of the shoe while hiking in Utah winter snow and trails.
review.name: Great shoe with great support

hasVariant.name: Pista Floor Pump
hasVariant.description: Buy the Silca Pista Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Having read the other review on this fantastic pump, I felt obligated to provide a different opinion.  I've use Silca pumps and chucks for eons and absolutely love them. Open the valve core (make sure you depress the valve once to release the seal), slide the chuck over, and pump.  No levers that bend your core stem when you wrench them down.  They work.  The main selling point for me in this pump is how compact it is.  It lays flat in my trunk.  No obnoxiously oversized gage (that generally aren't accurate anyway), no massive foot plate.  It only has what you really need.  I am dinging this pump one star for two reasons- the gage scale is just dumb.  It goes from 20 to 220.  I would prefer it started at 5 and went to 110 so you can gage lower pressure MTB tires (but as I said, I don't trust built in gages anyway and use a digital gage when it matters).  The other is the price.  This should be well under 100 for what you get.  But hey, It's a classic and it's Italian.  That's worth something, right?
review.name: Classic, compact, minimalist, quality

review.reviewBody:
I guess this is a classic product, and might be great for those trained in classic techniques.  But after carefully reading the instructions and attempting to inflate my tires six times, I gave up.  Five attempts failed: I only managed to deflate my tires.

The instructions say: To inflate a presta valve, unscrew the core nut, push the presta chuck over the valve stem and inflate.

One time, only some of the air was released when I pushed the presta chuck over the valve stem and I could inflate the tire without releasing air.  However, because the gauge is so small and on the floor, I could not really see the pressure.

The other five times, either all of the air in the tire was released when pushing the presta  chuck over the valve stem or I was unable to inflate the tire because more air came out as I attempted to inflate.

Even if the pump worked, it struck me as rather flimsy.  It's light and does not stand easily on its own.  And as I pointed out earlier, the gauge is small and on the ground: difficult to read.  It's missing a simple thing that could help: highlight key points, such as 100 psi.  The claim of 3 percent accuracy is a joke.  The gauge is so small, it's impossible to differentiate measurements to that scale.
review.name: Great for deflating tires

review.reviewBody: To the reviewers complaining about the small/narrow pump base- that is obviously an intentional feature. This is a great house pump, but also great to keep in the car, or store in a tight space. I own another Silca floor pump, and at $400 it does have a wider more stable base. This $100 pump is every bit as good as the more expensive Silca?s in terms of the actual pump parts, but it?s pared down in other ways to make it cheaper and easier to carry around. Every Silca pump is a Rolls Royce- some of them have wildly luxurious options, this one is the base model. But it?s still a Rolls Royce. After owning a half dozen terrible $60-100 pumps of the years, I?m glad I have pumps for life now. I?m flabbergasted this pump has any non-5 star reviews.
review.name: The last pump you?ll ever buy

name: Pista Floor Pump

review.reviewBody:
I wish I was able to actually review this product. I placed an order and was charged nearly $1,200 by Backcountry for this DrySuit, but I never received it. My address changed last May and right after I first placed the order Backcountry emailed me saying the billing address they had on file was different than my credit card info so they couldn’t complete the order.  I responded to their email saying I wanted to complete the order, and provided hem my updated billing and mailing address. They emailed me thanks for my business and processed the order. I also emailed them that their website wouldn’t allow me to update my billing and shipping information.

A few days later I noticed Backcountry shipped the $1,200 Kokatat Dry Suit to my old address which is about an hour from where I live. I emailed Backcountry, and they responded they’d contact FedEx to update the shipping information to my new address. At this point I thought this was settled.

A day later I checked my FedEx Tracking Number and notice it was still being delivered to my old address. I email them again, and also called them telling them this. They told me they were going to contact FedEx and cancel the order & have it sent back to them.  Once they had it back they were going to resend it to me via 2 day deliver at no cost to me. They also gave me  
$40 credit for my troubles. I again thought this was settled. 

A few days later I received an email from FedEx with a picture showing the Kokotat Dry Suit delivered to my old address.  I called Backcountry and spent over an hour on the phone with home on a Friday night after a long week of work. I wasn’t getting anywhere with them until they let me send them the email chain confirming everything I described. Once I did this and they reviewed it  the customer service person and their supervisor said I would either be provided a refund or a new dry suit, and they understood my frustrations. They said I’d need to call back the following week during regular work hours, and that everything we discussed would be in customer services notes when I called.  Again, I was relieved, and while not happy felt Backcountry would take care of this issue. After all,  it was entirely their fault they sent it to my old mailing address.

When I called back the new customer service person had no record of my prior call, and the person was not helpful at all. He said there is nothing they could do for me. I asked if I could provide him the email chain that proves what I’m saying. He essentially said no, but provided me a “customer experience” email he said goes to the manager. I sent this four days ago and still haven’t heard a response. I don’t have my dry suit, and have still been charged $1,169 for it by Backcountry. I can’t even believe this situation happened. I’m disgusted and am going to keep pushing this until they address this situation.
review.name: Backcountry Order for Kokotat Dry Suit
comment: Hi Mark, I have reached out to you via e-mail to help get this resolved. I hope to hear back from you soon!

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Short-Sleeve Pro Lyte Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great purchase, prefer this over the NX-G line of jerseys due to lack of garish graphics and branding. Supremely breathable, pair with a sleeveless base layer if you’re modest because it’s semi-opaque! Race fit but offers plenty of stretch, pockets do not sag despite super light fabric.
review.name: Summer essential

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Short-Sleeve Pro Lyte Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Had to return this as it was super light weight material, to the point of necessitating an underlayer or applying sunscreen to your whole torso.  If you want light light then this is your jersey! Looks good and fits well otherwise.  Have to try the regular FRC jersey, probably just right.
review.name: Much Lighter Material Than Hoped For

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Short-Sleeve Pro Lyte Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Wore it 3 times and started to fall apart.
Unfortunate because it's true to size and extremely comfortable on those Hot Days.
review.name: Durability

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Short-Sleeve Pro Lyte Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: My husband has had two of these jerseys. Love the fit and performance, but both within a few months of wearing have developed the same tear in the armpit panel. It's not a seam rip, it's a tear in the woven fabric, so no way to mend. The fabric used under the arm is simply too delicate for where it's placed. We have both exclusively worn Giordana FRC for years.
review.name: Agree with not durable

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Short-Sleeve Pro Lyte Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Got less than 2 seasons out of this jersey. I expected more, given the longevity that 4 pairs of Giordana bibs have proven. I suppose that isn't a complete disappointment, since it featured about twice in my weekly lineup for one and a half summers. Lightweight and was ideal for hot, humid rides. Unfortunately, the rear shoulder blade somehow wore through and led to a big gash, and that was it for this jersey. I'm very careful with how I wash and store my kit, so it was a disappointment to see this jersey have a short life.
review.name: Nice for humid rides, but not durable

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Short-Sleeve Pro Lyte Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is the best jersey I've found for 93 degrees in the sun with 55% humidity.  My only gripe is that I wish the front panel had been made with the same fabric as the back.  The front tends to hold moisture until you get over 20mph at which point you get great cooling.  If you're fast probably won't bother you.

Pair it with the same bib for best results.

6'1" 180lb.  Got the large in the jersey and the XL in the bib.  I have a long torso and the smaller bib would have been too short in the straps.  The rest of it fits great.
review.name: Great for hot, humid Texas weather

name: FR-C Short-Sleeve Pro Lyte Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: I purchased these insulated pants for the cold, stormy m, lift riding powder days here on mt. Hood. First day - fantastic! warm as advertised throughout the storm day. Many icy lift rides, comfortable, perfect amount of room but not baggy. Excellent pants! Love the deep pockets too.
review.name: Men’s Recon Insulated Pants

review.reviewBody:
These pants are like a cozy, warm hug for your legs, with a dash of James Bond-esque technology thrown in for good measure.

First off, let's talk about the weight. These pants are incredibly light weight considering the insulation and durability of the outer layer.

Now, let's talk about the vents. Oh, the vents! They're like the air conditioning system of the snow pants world. They let you release all that pent-up heat when you're working up a sweat which can be quickly closed for cold rides on the lift. 

The stretch in these pants is something else. It's like they were designed by a contortionist. You can twist, turn, and bend in any direction, and these pants will move with you like a well-trained dance partner. They're so flexible, you might just find yourself doing yoga in them.

But wait, there's more! The RECCO integration is like having a guardian angel on your side. If you ever find yourself in a sticky situation, this little piece of technology can help rescuers find you. It's like having a personal Bat-Signal, but for snow pants.

And let's not forget the insulation. It's like a warm blanket for your legs, but without the bulk. It's just enough to keep you cozy without making you feel like you're wearing a sleeping bag.

In conclusion, the Black Diamond Insulated Recon snow pants are a marvel of modern engineering. They're light, well-built, stretchy, and come with a side of high-tech safety features. If you're looking for a pair of snow pants that can keep up with your adventures, look no further. These pants are the real deal.

The only thing I’d like is some cargo pockets cause I’m a 90s kid like that.
review.name: Bueno!

review.reviewBody: These add the warmth I was looking for for lift skiing in the mountains. Warmer but still really light feeling. I like that if I do a boot pack hike out of bounds I can unzip the legs and dump heat. They are looser fitting than I like, actually baggy like old school pants. If I made a change I’d take them in and lose some legs pant rub noise when booting up. These are really nice pants for ripping around the resort.
review.name: Sweet Lift Access pants

review.reviewBody: The fit is perfect for me. L 5'11" -195#. The built in belt is a very nice feature and there is a bit of extra room in the waist to tuck in your base layer or a vest.
review.name: Very nice pants

review.reviewBody: When ordering, I sized down after reading other reviews saying the pants run big. I am 6' 170lbs with a 32 X 32 pant size. I ordered a Medium and the pants are comically too large and boxy. When spending good money on gear marked as high performance technical wear, it should fit properly. I will be returning.
review.name: Sizing issues

review.reviewBody: Warmer than it appears, fits perfectly. I like the deep pockets, and inner pouches. Fits my needs perfectly. This is better than I expected.
review.name: Functional and warm

review.reviewBody: These pants have just the right level of insulation for resort days in the Canadian Rockies. The additional belt loops are a nice in additional to the built in belt system. The material seems strong so far and takes some abuse.
review.name: Warm & Functional

review.reviewBody: I wear these with the matching jacket for skiing, snowboarding, and ice climbing and they’re great for being warm but not too warm during high output activities in freezing conditions. Love how secure the elastic cuffs are over my boots and appreciate the pockets to keep things dry and warm like my phone or wallet. I got a small and I’m 5’5” and 125lb. The waist fits well if I cinch the built in belt down. The legs are a little long for me but at 5’5” it’s pretty impossible to find anything that fits perfectly so I’m not complaining. The length is only really a problem if I’m wearing tennis shoes while driving to the mountains though and I can roll the elastic cuff up over the excess pant just fine. Looks a little wonky but gets the job done. Overall I’m a huge fan and don’t think I’ll need another pair of snow pants for quite some time.
review.name: Great pants for snowy mountain sports

review.reviewBody: I’m really impressed by these. Not a bad word to say.
review.name: Awesome snow pants

review.reviewBody: I wanted ski pants that provided a little more warmth than my goretex shell pants. These do the job great! Little warmer, little happier. The quality is top notch. Great zips!
review.name: Little warmer, little happier

name: Recon Insulated Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Good jacket, great rain pants. My son had them out on a rainy afternoon hike in the woods. Had some good steady rain and we were out for a couple hours. He remained dry throughout his adventures. Jacket hood is well designed, stayed in place and moved well with him so he maintained a good field of view. He did have a complaint that there were no pockets to place his collection of twigs, autumnal leaves, and snail shells. So, 4 out of 5 stars for the jacket pockets would be great. 5 out of 5 for the pants.

review.reviewBody: We don't get much rain so the jacket lives in my child's backpack. Our climate is quite hot so most rain jackets eventually delaminate. But this one is constructed differently so I am hopeful that if rain comes the rain jacket will work when needed.

description: Buy the Anker SOLIX BP3800 Expansion Battery online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: SOLIX BP3800 Expansion Battery
hasVariant.description: Buy the Anker SOLIX BP3800 Expansion Battery online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: High quality, sits nicely on top of my F3800 and adds another 3.8kw of power!
review.name: Great battery!

review.reviewBody: I bought the Solix FS3800 and one expansion battery to be used as a backup for power outages instead of running a generator for endless hour after hour. Haven't had an outage yet but am planning a test to see how it does with the grid power out. I love the 240 outlets. I can plug my heavy cords into this unit just like I do the big generator. Totally interchangeable.
review.name: My new go to system.

review.reviewBody: Awesome and powerful! I have 2 to a Solix f3800 and it’s already saving me $$$ from the grid using it combined with a smart home panel.
review.name: Small package, big surprise!

review.reviewBody: Easy to expand kWh of F3800. Just plug it in to the main unit and turn the main on. Great example of plug ‘n play. But it is really heavy. I had to get help to stack it on top of my F3800.
review.name: Expand!!

review.reviewBody: Love the plug and play of the F3800 and the BP3800 expansion batteries. Just plug it in and the F3800 handles it all seamlessly. Easy to use in my RV for when the power goes out.
review.name: Easy to set up.

review.reviewBody: I got this second BP3800 to raise my stored wattage to 11,400 to ensure a longer period between generator runs. Power outages have lasted up to 11 days here and we get tired of the noise especially at night. I will charge my Anker Solix batteries while running the house on generator and then switch to quiet battery power over night.
review.name: All night quiet

review.reviewBody: I sent my boss to you to purchase an F3800 battery system for our office in the courthouse. You refused to honor the coupon I sent them, and then refused to do business with us. Government offices aren't allowed to use credit cards, and most businesses order with net 30 purchasing. You apparently have no idea just how much business you are throwing away by accepting only credit cards. I can't recommend you to my friends. I already did and you refused to do business with them. Too bad, your products are pretty good, and could save a lot of businesses lots of money. I can't help but be dissapointed.
review.name: Good Product, Poor sales Policies

review.reviewBody: Outstanding unit. It has done exactly as advertised and more. I have recommended it to a few friends and they are looking into it!
review.name: Outstanding unit. It has done

review.reviewBody: Works like a charm. Just downloaded the app and this unit responds.
review.name: Second unit

review.reviewBody: While I’m writing this review, we are currently in a power outage in parts of Houston due to a storm. So I’m really greatfull to have purchased this when I did. This thing works exactly as it’s supposed to, and so easy to use. It’s well made, but it is very heavy. Hoping to add more solar and batteries to it soon.
review.name: Very impressed

name: SOLIX BP3800 Expansion Battery

review.reviewBody: These are the best for cold days - hands down, no contest. The wind cannot get through. It takes a looong time for cold to get through - of ever.
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: Good fabric (both the shell twill & the flannel lining) and appears to be well constructed. Unfortunately the fit is terrible. I take a 34/34, and have for the last 20 years. These are the right length and fit (straight, on the slim side but not skinny). The gusset in the crotch tho seems to be in the wrong place (towards the back, why?) and the rise is *way* too short. Makes it very uncomfortable to sit down in these pants, because everything gets bound up tight. Also, and this is more style than function I guess, but it's unclear to me why the back patch pockets start and finish so low. The bottom of the pocket is nearly down to my knee.
review.name: Bad fit / save yer $

name: Hot Rydr Pant - Men's
