review.reviewBody: Comparing this to other jackets at this price (or even higher) in the market this is honestly one of the best designs and quality of material. BUT, the front zipper is terrible and the thin leathery plastic that seals the seams is stretched when opening and closing the zip. On the inside also the finishes and the seems did not look as robust which such a shame because it really is a great jacket with great features. I’m returning this because I was hoping for a jacket that would last longer at this price
review.name: Excellent design but disappointing finish

review.reviewBody: I wont be using this until next season but so far it seems very nice.  The sleeves are quite long and the shoulders seem kind of narrow.  My chest measurements  match the large but I had to return it because it was massive in the mid section and super long. I ended up with a medium and the mid section and sleeves fit nice but shoulders are tight. Its definitely designed around a slender/skinny build.  I like the pocket locations and the neck collar sits nice and tall with a helmet hood.  The yellow color is interesting, which is what drew me to it.  Almost lime.  Im 5'10" 185 lbs. I wrote the review because Backcountry keeps sending me emails to review. I also hate reading reviews from people that haven't tried things so I feel your pain.  Saying I used it once or twice was the lowest option. 4 stars for sizing.
review.name: Checks All The Boxes So Far

review.reviewBody: Bought this about a month ago for skiing in Tahoe. Fit what I was looking for in terms of style, features and price. Everything is fairly good, but the front main zipper can be challenging to zip up at times. It's a little finicky which is frustrating when you're also wearing a set of ski gloves.
review.name: High quality jacket - zipper is cumbersome

review.reviewBody:
First, the fit:
I'm 6'6" (198cm) and 230lbs (105kg), and I have spent my entire skiing life having to wear jackets either far too short or far too wide for my preference. Enter the Moon Patrol. I ordered in XL (my ideal t-shirt size is Large Tall), and it fits PERFECTLY. Plenty of room for broad shoulders, but the torso matches the contours of my body while leaving just enough room for layering. No more wearing a giant billowing marshmallow suit just to get my length! The back extends comfortably below my rear, and the sleeves are long enough to cover my entire wrist with my arms straight out. It seriously looks tailor-made. This jacket fits 10x better than other brands' tall sizes (Colum-something, Ober-something...), so if you're a fellow tall skier who has spent months worth of hours hunting the elusive jacket that will look correct on you, take my word for it: this is what you've been looking for. It even looks great on my 6'8" dad!

Now, onto the construction:
I can justify every penny of the price tag as I wear this thing. Every single aspect, from the wrist gaiters to the zippers, just screams quality. I almost sprang for the S/Lab Gore-Tex jacket and glad I didn't, because I cannot think of a single thing I would or could improve about this jacket. The material is durable and completely water- and windproof, and yet moves with your body effortlessly. The pockets are perfectly placed. The hood is spacious enough for my XL helmet yet collapses flat when down. To put it simply: I'm in love. 10/10, five stars, holy cow, what the heck. Buy one!
review.name: The Tall Skier's Holy Grail

review.reviewBody: i am 6 feet 4 inches and225 pounds the jacket fits great long enough to give me good coverage on my back i have large shoulders so went for 2 xl hate shells being tight lots of room to layer the storage and pockets are very roomy hood fits helmet great super jacket
review.name: jacket that fita a big guy

name: Moon Patrol GORE-TEX Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Supply 65L Duffel Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using this duffel on road trips and it’s excellent for lighter duty adventures. The bag is extremely light weight which seems to be a specialty of Gregory. I have a lot of there gear and it’s all very light. If you’re packing carefully you could easily fit 2 weeks of clothes into this bag. The incorporated back pack straps are very nice too, the tuck out of sight when you don’t need them and quickly deploy when you do. For most people I would say it’s the perfect size bag with just the right amount durability.
review.name: Perfect all around duffel

review.reviewBody: I bought this duffel to use as a swim bag, for which it is perfect. Holds our swim clothes, towels, pool toys, change of clothes, etc etc. I would like to suggest two improvements. 1) an interior zippered pocket for valuables 2) an interior elastic band or mesh compartment for keeping a 32 oz water bottle upright.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: Great bag, well made. Seems like it will last for a long time. Zippers and handles are top notch. Getting the shoulder straps in and out of their storage area is a little cumbersome. Also, if you're not using both of the shoulder straps as a backpack and only using one strap like a traditional duffel bag, the strap really isn't made for this and doesn't sit evenly on the shoulder. Love that it folds down and stores into it's zippered exterior pocket.
review.name: Great take on a traditional duffel bag!

name: Supply 65L Duffel Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband was so embarrassed I kept wearing my previous icebreaker from time to time, even though it become literally threadbare in a couple areas. Was nervous an updated version might not be as good, as often happens when one buys a replacement for something they've loved so much, but so far this one has the same fit and feel as my beloved first icebreaker shirt. As well, they are usually "updated" colors offered and I was glad this one is pretty close to the original. I'm sure I'll get as many years wear out of this one as I did my first and recommend it strongly to anybody who likes winter sports or just comfortable shirts to hang out in during cooler seasons.
review.name: Closet, staple for sure

name: 150 ZoneKnit Long-Sleeve Crew Top - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Nepal EVO GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent quality boot for a high altitude mountaineering ascent. Used them in Pico de Orizaba yesterday with an excellent performance!
review.name: Excellent Quality Boot

review.itemreviewed: Nepal EVO GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Love this boot. Been out several times in ice/snow and it’s totally solid. Fit  is fantastic. Was a bit of a risk as I  had a pair of Makulas and the fit just want right for me. 

Great with crampons.
review.name: Wonderful fit. Solid boot.

review.itemreviewed: Nepal EVO GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I opted for the sportiva napal GTX some months back, tha hallmark of a great boot is no brake in time, it was a perfect fit from the start, always take the socks you’ll be wearing when trying out new boots, my favorite pair right now.
review.name: My favorite right now

review.itemreviewed: Nepal EVO GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super comfortable right out of the box. I had expected some break in miles would be necessary before I took these on a serious trip but was surprised they felt so good right from the start. I put about 5 miles on them to verify fit and pack in the padding. Only changes I had to make was learning the best way to tighten the laces. They are warm and rugged. Work great with MSR Lightning Ascent snowshoes and Grivel G14 (strap) crampons. Automatics would be a treat.
review.name: Comfortable right out of the box.

review.itemreviewed: Nepal EVO GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Do yourself a favor and buy a full size to a size and a half over your normal shoe size. I wish this review was here for me to make a better decision. The Boots are warm and dry while walking in snow and icy watery mixes. Other than the sizing issue I like them.
review.name: RUNS SMALL

name: Nepal EVO GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Been looking for comfortable tall rubber boots for years, knew if they were Ariat they would be quality
review.name: Quality

review.reviewBody: Disappointed that just 1 year in and my boots are leaking already.  I had expected more from Ariat to be honest.
review.name: Leaking after 12 months
comment:
We are sorry to read your review and the issue you have experienced. We firmly stand behind everything we produce, that’s why every Ariat product comes with a 12-month warranty.
Please look out for an email from our Customer Care team.

review.reviewBody: I love these boots. I live in a cold, mountainous climate and wear these boots almost daily. They’re so comfortable and look great with leggings. They fit perfectly. Great for rainy and snowy days. Will definitely order another pair.
review.name: New favorite boots

review.reviewBody:
I bought these in May (5 months ago) and was very pleased with how comfortable they were. I haven’t needed to wear them very much over the summer period but started wearing them daily a few weeks ago and one is leaking. No obvious hole but appears it’s the seal around the toe. Very disappointed with the quality and can see from other reviews that this seems to be a known problem.
Would not recommend buying
review.name: Would not recommend
comment:
We are sorry to read your review and the issue you have experienced. We firmly stand behind everything we produce, that’s why every Ariat product comes with a 12-month warranty.
Please look out for an email from our Customer Care team.

review.reviewBody:
I bought a pair last year after being recommended them by some horse owner friends. "They'll last for years" I was told. 
I have had one winter season out of them and recently got them out of storage for wet dog walks to find they are no longer water tight! The wellies are the most comfortable I've ever owned but I absolutely do not expect my feet to be wet inside them after about 6 months worth of wear.
review.name: Comfortable but not water proof
comment:
We are sorry to read your review and the issue you have experienced. We firmly stand behind everything we produce, that’s why every Ariat product comes with a 12-month warranty.
Please look out for an email from our Customer Care team.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable - a little heavy but very well made and I believe they will last a long time.
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody:
Finally a pair of tough rubber work boots! With the Ariat brand foot bed, interior lining, and style. They are a wee bit warm for summer heat (that’s why God made Crocs) but will give my Berwicks a permanent break from cleaning stalls in the cold. 

Thank you, Ariat, for the Perfect Barn Boots.
review.name: Perfect Barn Boots

review.reviewBody: I was not expecting these to be so darn comfortable!  You just can’t beat Ariat footwear!
review.name: New favorite rubber boots!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sturdy rubber boots. Comfy but a bit heavy to walk around in

review.reviewBody: This shirt is great for everything. Such a nice fit and amazing fabric. I ended up getting it in more colors
review.name: One of my favorites

review.reviewBody: Washes beautifully. Great color. Doesn’t ride up. Great for yoga. Dress it up or be casual. Great fit.
review.name: Lots of compliments

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this top. I currently have it in three colors. I also have two of the long sleeves. It’s so soft and comfortable.
review.name: My favorite shirt

review.reviewBody: absolutely love this shirt and the tank version, very soft and love that I can wear it to workout or for casual things.
review.name: loooooove

review.reviewBody: I love this casual top. It's the perfect length and the material is so soft and cozy. I usually wear size S and sometimes XS on looser fitting tops because I don't like my tops to drown me. The size S fits me great - comfortably loose. It pairs well with leggings. Only con is I wish it wasn't so pricey.
review.name: Soft and versatile

review.reviewBody: I’m seriously buying every color in multiple sizes. You should too because the fit is a little loose, not too slouchy. Incredibly soft fabric, a flattering fit and I actually sized down for a casual look with my jeans but am going to buy my normal size Small for riding my peloton. The hang loop is on the outside of the shirt which is great for me to hang dry after swimming. One weird thing that might bug some people is that the white colorway has a black size label on in inside neck. Does not bother me but might be a no go for some on a white shirt.
review.name: Hello 👋 buy them all - in every color

review.reviewBody:
This is one of my all time favorite shirts. Love the material, the softness and the fit!
I have it in 2 colors and would definitely buy more if you repeat the shirt and I hope you do!
review.name: Destination Crew Top- Women

review.reviewBody: Trying to stock up on more shirts that give better sun protection and this is one of my favorites, really lightweight and soft and looks great on!
review.name: Soft, light weight shirt

review.reviewBody: It is true to size and feels amazing.
review.name: Great shirt

review.reviewBody: Please, please, whoever is reading these, MAKE MORE COLORS. I have bought two of these, in the same color, simply because I want to wear it all of the time and needed a backup for when one is dirty. If I could wear this top, and this top only, while camping, hiking, walking, LIVING, I would. The fit is perfect and the material is so incredibly soft.
review.name: FAVORITE TOP

name: Destination Crew Top - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Hydro Next Gen Hiker Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wanted to like these, but these aren't up to Merrell's old standards.  Let's just say at the root of the problem is that they have no "body." It is impossible to cinch them up enough for even moderate downhill walking or especially hiking.   Your toes will soon agree these are pretty worthless.
review.name: Not very good

review.itemreviewed: Hydro Next Gen Hiker Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have bought a bunch of shoes from this company over the years. But these are not as comfortable as the rest and the cost was higher then I would have spent. The run large I wear size 11 and these fit like  a 12 or 12.5 so I’ve tried to wear them and can’t and I can’t send them back.
review.name: Not the normal Merrill I have come to love

review.itemreviewed: Hydro Next Gen Hiker Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and surprisingly supportive considering it is a slip on. The wide stance is responsible I suspect
review.name: Comfortable and Supportive

review.itemreviewed: Hydro Next Gen Hiker Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes are a disappointment. Don’t recommend.
review.name: Missed the mark for Merrell
comment: We're sorry to hear these weren't for you. If we can help please give us a call at 800-288-3124. Happy to do all we can!

review.itemreviewed: Hydro Next Gen Hiker Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wore the shoes in Western Canada hiking. They were a good fit. Saved me from blisters.
review.name: Good fit

review.itemreviewed: Hydro Next Gen Hiker Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I thought these hikers would be perfect: light, attractive for a female with wide feet and fashion forward.  But my custom orthotics would not fit as the provided insole is not removable.  My mistake, my loss.  I had to return them.
review.name: great shoes but not for accepting custom orthotics
comment: Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Hydro Next Gen Hiker Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Light weight cool in heat very comfortable fit these are perfect every day shoes and comfortable when driving long distance.
review.name: These are quickly my go to shoes daily

review.itemreviewed: Hydro Next Gen Hiker Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Like the feel similar to other hiking shoes. Nice thing is it doesn't need tying laces
review.name: Looks great in this color
comment: Thanks so much for your great feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Hydro Next Gen Hiker Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I walk 12,000 steps a day and replaced my worn shoes about a month ago with this model and I love them! The sole is slightly wider than I'm used to, but I find it helps stability, and the heel gives just enough bounce to keep me happy whether my walk is down Broadway in New York, a back road in the mountains of Colorado, or up and down the Hudson Valley hills. A great design that I highly recommend.
review.name: Innovative marriage of Vibram sole and mesh uppers
comment: Appreciate the fantastic feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Hydro Next Gen Hiker Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Gave this one a try and found it very uncomfortable.  On the positive end, everything about the upper, including the drawcord, was fine for me and I think they look great in person.

But the huge problem is it doesn't feel like a cohesive shoe.  Walking in it, the upper and sole don't feel well connected and are simply quite uncomfortable. Its immediately noticeable and not a problem I've had with other Merrell shoes.  For me too there is a feeling of the heel being higher that I don't enjoy very much. 

Avoid this one.
review.name: Disappointing Shoe
comment: We're sorry to hear this style did not work for you. If we can help please give us a call t 800-288-3124. Thank you.

name: Hydro Next Gen Hiker Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Feedback Sports Omnium Over-Drive Portable Trainer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Omnium Over-Drive Portable Trainer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Feedback Sports Omnium Over-Drive Portable Trainer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The Feedback Sports Ommium Overdrive is a very well built, compact sized trainer. It folds very compact so it can be stored under the sofa or standing in a corner inside its bag. 

I'm an occasional cyclist that needed a compact trainer for a small apartment, for those rainy days or just the COVID19 quarantine. It's so easy to setup and just start cycling in minutes.

Tip: for a perfect wheel placement on back rollers, turn the rollers inwards - toward the center of the bike wheel, until you feel the friction is equal on both sides and wheel doesn't turn easily to either side. If not, just losen the adjusting screw and adjust slightly. The perfect adjustment will prevent vibration on back wheel.
review.name: Portable and well built

name: Omnium Over-Drive Portable Trainer

hasVariant.description: Buy the 686 Hydrastash Sync GORE-TEX Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great jacket, awesome features. I like the chest vents, and pockets for ski pass and cell phone
review.name: Great jacket, awesome features. I

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Only worn on one two-day snowboarding trip, but so far the jacket is good quality and looks sharp. Water resistance decent. The hydrastash is a total joke—the reservoir is junk quality and the tip is a piece of garbage, water constantly sprays or leaks out of the tip no matter what you do. I am 6 foot 200 lbs and wear a large. XL was too big.
review.name: Jacket good hydrastash junk

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Another great product designed by 686, i love the hard feeling of the material and it feels sick!

I chose the bright orange color and it feels amazing just like the picture. Of coz u cant miss the water bladder which keeps u hydrated on the mountain and it doesnt impact ur balance at all, great product 686
review.name: Totally rad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great coat! Worn twice, both days were clear with windy conditions and temps in the 30’s. It was warm with no drafts. Mouth piece was easy to access and the thumb loops are handy.
review.name: Great coat! Worn twice, both

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The main zipper to close the jacket is brutally tough. It always seems to catch and I feel like maybe the jacket was not well made. I have a trip and will be using but I feel like it’s a defective jacket.
review.name: Bad zippers

review.reviewBody: This is a fantastic jacket that fits true to size. I wore it with just a ninja suit and was warm and dry in 20 degree weather. Keeps the wind out as well and perfect pocket space! The hydrastash was great so that I didn't have to stop for the majority of the day as well.
review.name: Excellent Jacket!

review.reviewBody:
This jacket is great. It's a perfect amount of insulation on a day that isn't really cold. It blocks the wind completely and is completely waterproof. I really like the thumb loop on the inside of the cuffs to help the cuff stay over the gloves. I just realized it had this feature and now I use it all the time.

My only complaint is I wish it had an outside chest pocket for my phone. It does have an internal phone pocket though.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Hydrastash jacket by 686 is amazing! Such a great fit and the hydration bladder is awesome. I'm going to buy another colorway as well..This jacket can handle any major winter storm that my state of Wyoming can throw out. It's a must buy for any advanced skier or rider
review.name: This Hydrastash jacket by 686

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Run true size very well made makes my days cero worries about getting wet materials are very well
Made … lots of pockets so happy with my purchase
review.name: Run true size very well

review.reviewBody: Fit is perfect, construction is well done and the goretex beads up perfect as it should.
review.name: Fit is perfect, construction is

name: Hydrastash Sync GORE-TEX Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I really like Icebreaker products; have many. When I put these on I really loved the way the tights these felt. I ordered a M but there was extra fabric bunching feeling in the crotch area so I sent back. Will try a S. However, note that Icebreaker does not do exchanges so you have to return first then buy again-and the return process was NOT seamless, it was an ordeal as they sent me the wrong label and as a result I went to USPS, UPS and FedEx with package until it was established it was a Canadian return label. So US buyers take note.
review.name: Nice tights; runs a little large; messy return process

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's Warm for 10- 15 Celsius (50 - 65 F) Degree. Great for Califonia Winter Morning Run. Very Breathable, I don't feel lack of air flow. The best Jugging pats for winter. I Like so much, I bought 2nd one. The Cell Phone pocket is another big plus
review.name: Love it so much ....

review.itemreviewed: Durand Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Stitching in the toe area failed and instantly starting leaking after only 8 months.
 Also the leather is absolutely NOT waterproof. The first pair I got years ago were not either, so nothing has changed there. A split second under the faucet will prove to you that it just "wets-out" almost immediately, so you will should waterproof them yourself.
review.name: Poor thread stitching & leather itself is NOT wp.

review.itemreviewed: Durand Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Durand Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have owned several pair of these boots and always pleased with the fit and stability. This pair does not have a pull tab on the back which I prefer but they are easy to slip on. Time will tell if the seams around the toe area split like my previous boots.
review.name: Good boot

review.itemreviewed: Durand Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: First off I love they are made in the USA. This is my 3rd pair of your Durand boots. I wear them just about every day to work and work around my acreage. Let’s just say they get used! I average about 2 years each and wear them till the soles are down to nothing so they are a good bargain to boot. No pun intended. Lol
review.name: Don’t Change A Thing!

hasVariant.name: Alpine Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Alpine Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Can't go wrong with these Alpine Pants. They are just the right weight for the alpine, warm enough for alpine starts and breathable enough for hot afternoons. Great stretch and built for movement over technical terrain.
review.name: Great design and fabric

review.reviewBody: I bought these on a Black Friday sale and they didn’t fit. The only option I have is to now buy a larger size at full retail price as there is no exchange option.
review.name: Pants don’t fit and can’t exchange

review.reviewBody: Hands down the best pants I’ve ever worn. The 4-way stretch, the breathability, the overall fit…these hit the bullseye.
review.name: Hands down the best pants

review.reviewBody: About as pragmatic as it comes. Love the leg zipper for stashing quick access items. The fit is athletic without being tight. The light water repellency helps keep the smell of whisky off on pants during the long weeks at the creek.
review.name: Classic bangers

review.reviewBody: This is a well thought out pant. The integrated belt is one of the better ones on the market, and the ankle cinches are handy. Nicely stretchy, good weight material- light enough to not overheat but heavy enough to feel pretty durable
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody: Finally a pair of pants that can fit my tiny 28” waist as a guy with normal length legs.
review.name: Fit perfectly and has large pockets!

review.reviewBody:
Not as warm, durable, or versatile as BD Vertical or Dawn Patrol pants of yesteryear, but a darn good alternative. Fit is much better. I am 5'9 inch waist 33 waist and this pants adjustable waist loop goes from starving-alpine-decent to all-you-can-eat sushi with room to spare. The hem is longer than most other pants I own, so tall guys will appreciate that. For me, it helps keeps the snow/pebbles out. So far, the fabric has been pretty durable. I got another two pair in case BD decided to change sizing or discontinue these pants. The weight/warmth is not great for hot summer or windy-cold summit, other than that it is pretty darn versatile. 

As a sign note, BD, please adjust your sizing for the Alpine Light pant to resemble these pants. Your Alpine Winter pants are also great for conditions where this pant isn't warm enough.
review.name: Great athletic fit, long length, durable fabric, versatile weight/insulation.

review.reviewBody: Great for climbing, super durable, holds up against similar brands in terms of comfort, look great. Strongly recommend.
review.name: Some of the best climbing pants you can buy

review.reviewBody: I work in construction and spend my free time in the hills. These pants are both rugged and flexible!
review.name: The only pant I’ll buy for work or mountaineering.

review.reviewBody:
Got a pair with thicker premium Schoeller Swiss fabric a few years ago - which were also stitched a bit differently (e.g. stitched in back pocket vs free hanging) and a metal latch on the built-in belt vs plastic type now. They were fantastic.
The new ones are a bit lighter wt but appear to be made of a similar stretch material. They are also very comfortable. Look to be well stitched, good quality zippers. Would recommend. Good product
review.name: Alpine pants still really good

name: Alpine Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great boots, expected. Don't see any quality degradation from previous durable pair of Blunnies
review.name: Awesome boots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shoe. I love the color (a Faherty exclusive apparently). Wore in rain and worked well, seem like they will hold up to a lot of wear.
review.name: Great shoe. I love the

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wide and too bulky. Likely a result of my large size. My wife has a similar pair and loves them.
review.name: Wide and too bulky. Likely

review.reviewBody: Shoes look nice, but are way too tight. I have worn size 13 my entire life, in all brands. They all fit fine. Except these Blundstones. The right shoe is way too tight at the top of the foot, near the ankle joint.  As they are leather, I thought they would stretch with wear, so I kept them. I've worn them. I've put a shoe stretcher in the boot. I sprayed with shoe stretcher leather spray. Still too tight. I should have just returned them during the return window. But now I'm too late. Bummer.
review.name: Too Tight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Always wanted this style boot. Waited for the right one. This was it!!!
review.name: Fabulous everyday boot

review.reviewBody: Gave this as a gift to my husband and he loves them. He has another pair just like them in a different color and swears by this brand. He works on his feet a lot and says they are comfy and worth every penny
review.name: 2nd pair Ive bought

review.reviewBody: I love these boots, but I learned the hard way how to size. They are true to size so get your usual US size, what causes confusion is the conversion from the US to AUS sizes where they say size down, but they mean size down FOR AUS sizes. If you have narrow feet half size down, or wide feet, half size up. At first, they seem big but that's normal! The slip is there temporarily until they form to your feet. So keep your normal size and you'll be in the clear, just be careful if you wear say a 10, sizing down a half will cause it to drop to a 9.5 meaning the shoe is more narrow but a little bit shorter. A good pair of leather boots that will last without the annoying holes and tearing of regular shoes, not to mention how versatile they are.
review.name: Great shoes, be wary of sizing confusion

review.reviewBody: Be careful with the sizing because the boots are made in Australia. But, we love our boots
review.name: Comfortable, waterproof, stylish- a perfect boot.

review.reviewBody: That?s right! If someone told me I could only have one pair of shoes for the rest of my life, they?d be Blunnies! Versatility, comfort and all around style are what make these puppies appealing; not to mention durability. I?m on my second pair now after the first pair met their match after 3 years of (literally) every day wear, 5 continents, 30ish countries and 48 of the US states about 10 times over. Enough ranting though; you will love these boots for years.
review.name: A true ?last pair on earth? shoe

name: Original 500 Chelsea Boot - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Luxe Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: I recently used this on a camp trip in the mountains in VA. Awesome pad that didn’t pop or get a hole in it. I’m glad I went with the XL model being 6’2” and around 260lbs. I didn’t slide off and it’s the first camp pad that went past my shoulder blades. Very happy overall.
review.name: Great for bigger guys!

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Luxe Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: I was skeptical at first because the description said it was insulated and when I received it, it was rolled up paper-thin. But somehow it works. I have only used it camping with low temps in the 40s so far, but I never had that feeling of all the warmth getting sucked out through the mattress like other inflatables I have used. It is also plenty wide enough for 6'3" dude and the V-shape is surprisingly comfortable.
review.name: Unbelievably good

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Luxe Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: need to mention that it requires an air pump to inflate.
review.name: undecided
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Luxe Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: After being in the wilderness of the Montana backcountry for 12 days I fell in love with this mat! I’m a larger guy at 6’ 3” and at 235# the mat was very comfortable and stayed inflated the whole trip. Very easy to inflate and deflate. Highly recommended to anyone and everyone!! I’ll never buy another brand again. Thank you Klymit
review.name: 12 Days in the Montana backcountry!

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Luxe Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: Ease of use one way valve makes inflation/deflation a literal breeze. Keeps you warm off the ground.
review.name: Perfect ground insulator.

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Luxe Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: I have a smaller Klymit sleeping pad and was needing to upgrade to a bigger one and didn‚Äôt think twice about who to get it from and it is everything I thought it would be the width is perfect I slept really well on it
review.name: I have a smaller Klymit

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Luxe Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: I love my new mattress! It&#x27;s a bit heavier than my old one, but my arms don&#x27;t hang off the edges at night. Also, it keeps me warm in cooler night time temperatures.
review.name: I love my new mattress!

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Luxe Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: I've been using these Klymit pads for years and love them. Used this one while hiking Aconcagua in sub-zero temps and was great. Couldn't feel the rocky ground and stayed warm under the sleeping bag.
review.name: Love the Klymit sleeping pads

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Luxe Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: Awesome pad works great and comfortable. I also bought the XL version too so when my wife goes camping with me we can use a larger pad together.
review.name: Awesome pad works great and

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Luxe Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: Great for back country sleeps the little extra weight is totally worth carrying. I sleep on my sides most and never bottom out.

name: Insulated Static V Luxe Sleeping Pad

hasVariant.description: Buy the Hammerhead Karoo Bike Computer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: When the Karoo works, it's great.  But when it won't start, after resets, and takes 30 + minutes to start - it is beyond frustrating when you spent close to $500.  I'm on my second unit thinking it was a fluke that I had issues with it.  Now even if I get it to start it will turn off by itself and it appears as if it is trying to restart (screen flashing). I've been instructed to do a hard reset many times - the problem is you have to turn it off and the unit cannot be turned off once it starts flashing.
review.name: STAY AWAY FROM THIS UNIT

name: Karoo Bike Computer

hasVariant.name: Bucket Rac
hasVariant.description: Buy the BOTE Bucket Rac online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Bucket Rac is perfect addition to my tandem kayak. Holds my rods perfectly and keeps my Kula in place. I have gone through waves and everything stays in its place. Well done BOTE!
review.name: Bucket Rac works great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This rack no only holds & protects our Cooler, but can hold up to 4 fishing rods!
review.name: Handy & Versatile!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Using the Bucket rac is a great way to show off our Kula cooler and the rod holders are a plus !
review.name: Show off time !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The rack is fantastic and great quality. Love the rod holders
review.name: Great rack and rod holder

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy to instal and easy to use - plug and play ready :) we used it on our Zepplin Kayak with Kula cooler. Looking forward to taking it on a fishing trip soon.
review.name: Easy to instal and easy

review.reviewBody: I love the rack and how it should work in theroy. However, the Kula, doesn’t fit all the way down into it. The handle on the Kula gets in the way and you have metal on metal rubbing. The new white rack I purchase now is all scuffed up from the Kula. It’s like the Kula is a couple inches to short so it hovers slightly above the board. A little disappointed.
review.name: Kula Doesn’t Fit Properly

review.reviewBody: Have taken this out on my aero rover and I love it
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: A must have for the Zeppelin Kayak. Easy to put our fishing rods in!
review.name: Joe G

review.reviewBody: The Bucket Rac is a great addition to my HD Aero board. It is well-constructed and solid, but light-weight, and the black coating is very nice. It is easy to install and allows me to keep my fishing rods handy and know they are secure as I paddle to various fishing spots. I don't have the compatible cooler but the Bucket Rac is perfect for securing a cooler bag and other gear. I contemplated getting the Tackle Rac at first but I'm really glad I got the Bucket Rac instead: it has a lower profile, is not in the way at all, and provides the versatility I was looking for.
review.name: Great addition to my board

review.reviewBody: Couldn't ask for a better way to have your Kula cooler and fishing poles set on a BOTE board! Love it!
review.name: Outstanding!

name: Bucket Rac

hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Lithium Sleeping Bag: 0F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Replaced my old marmot bag with this one after many years of service. Short bag is great for my height 5' 5". Bag dries quickly from tent condensation. Zipper design keeps bag from getting caught - nice when adjusting for warmth in middle of night.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody:
Lithium is one of the lightest solid elements on the periodic table, which explains why Marmot chose that name for this 0-degree F bag. This bag is made up of 800-fill hydrophobic down and a very thin face fabric in order to give it incredible lightness and compressibility. But to keep the bag light, Marmot opted to use a smaller draft collar and draft tube than you may find on some other 0-degree F bags, which reduces it's cold-temperature ability some.

"Winter" has only just begun in the Adirondacks, so I took this bag and my two-person summer tent on a recent 2-night backcountry camping trip. I was able to fit everything into a 58L pack, and my total pack weight was only about 27 pounds with water and food. I hiked 2.5 miles and 1200 ft elevation gain to my campsite, and pitched my tent on about 3 inches of snow and ice. My sleep system was my Lithium 0-degree F bag, XTherm sleeping pad, and Aeros pillow. I did not use a bag liner. Inside the bag I only wore my hooded baselayer top at night (no bottoms or socks), and I did not use any heat packs or hot water bottles.

The outside temperature began around 25 degrees F and got down to about 15 degrees F at night. The bag performed very well. I did not feel cold in my core or lower body. There was some heat escaping from my chest area, probably due to the minuscule draft collar, but it wasn't bad once I zipped the bag all the way up and cinched the hood. The anti-snag zipper worked great, but the inside pocket is basically useless. In the morning, I noticed the typical wetness near the face opening of the bag from breathing/condensation, but it quickly dried out. The bag never felt like it was holding excessive moisture. Overall, I was very happy with the bag. I think this bag's advertised 0-degree F rating might be possible with thermal weight baselayers and a bag liner, but this bag is ideal for temps above 10-degrees F.
review.name: Very light, compressible, and warm

review.reviewBody: This is significantly heavier than the previous lithium model and also just doesn't feel as well made.not worth full price.
review.name: This is a downgrade from the previous model
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.
 
At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.
 
We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.name: Legit and Top Quality
